posts.cooked: Hello! For a few months now, I receive an error message saying that my contacts cannot be synched, rendering Signal pretty much useless as I am not able to send any messages unless someone messages me first. This is a major issue as I change phones quite frequently. I tried to replicate the issue and it occurs in the same way on OxygenOS, One UI and Pixel OS but notably not on iOS. I tried everything from clearing cache, uninstalling/reinstalling, toggling VPN and custom DNS on and off, and even deleting my Signal account and registering again but to no avail. Has anyone else experienced this issue or does anyone have any suggestions how to solve it?

Hi,

Where exactly are you recieving the error message? Is the issue with importing phone contacts (i e. from your phone’s address book) or syncing already established signal contacts (i e. contacts you already had signal conversations with in the past)?

And have you by any chance - maybe even by accident - not granted (or even revoked) contact access permission for Signal on OS level?

Maybe posting a debug log here would help us supporting you.

It’s at the top of the screen (see screenshots). I believe Signal cannot sync my phone’s contacts. But there is no difference on phones that have a very limited number of contacts, so the underlying reason must be something else.

10001604611080×475 38.9 KB

10001604601080×968 85.3 KB

I double checked that but all permissiibs are granted. How do I upload a text file here? The debug long is too long to copy/paste.

10001621001080×2376 120 KB
You should be provided a link which can be posted here.

Got it. I just downloaded the .txt file. Here it is:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.50.1/fe5819dd0197ae7db1290fcf93382014c606959d722c6022c127e901ad8650d9

The “Too many contacts gave been processed” error seems self-explanatory to me and looks just like this Contact syncing issue problem,

May I ask how many contacts do you have on your phone? If it’s exceptionally high number, contact discovery service might rate-limit requests.
Roughly 1.5k but the problem also occurs on my Pixel, which has less than 10. The problem does not occur on my iPhone which has 2,310 contacts.

Adding this blurb so it let’s me post it..

Bumping this up as I’m still experiencing the same issue. Submitted another debug log but still did not receive an answer from the Signal team:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.54.1/2d7ea99b5422870bb0c0d556cacf400caedc9edd48b920eb3be514b8b0304692
Are these all separate signal accounts, each on the official, current client?

No, just one Signal account on the original client but I am having two separate issues. One is the fact that it cannot retrieve my contacts and the other that weird ‘Media message’ issue whenever I receive a message from someone. Both issues only occur on Android (Pixel OS, One UI, OxygenOS and GrapheneOS) but not on iOS which I find particularly odd. Unfortunately now my Signal account is locked as well, I believe because of registering and deregistering so frequently. I have tried to fully delete my Signal account and create a new one but that didn’t solve the problem either.
The quota for contact discovery might of course be different between iOS and Android, which would explain the difference between platforms, but of course that’s doesn’t help your problem…
Agreed, but I don’t think this is the root cause as I am encountering the same problem on GrapheneOS and I only have about a dozen contacts on that phone..
Yes, but since it’s the same account, it might be “compromised” already from having too many contacts on the other device. Just a guess, but might be possible.
Ah, I see. I suppose the only way to find out is to purge loads of contacts.
Possibly. If you’re contacts aren’t saved locally, you could simply disconnect the CardDAV instance or Google contacts or whatever and see if that helps.
Sounds good, I will try. Unfortunately, my account is locked again after switching between devices.

suggested_topics.fancy_title: From 2 Signal Accounts to 1 (and from 2 phones to 1)
